discussion.content: If I'm not mistaken, an Opportunity is an optional record that's created.

You can only choose to update an opportunity if there is an opportunity associated with the account already in the system. The option to 'Choose Existing' is grayed out if there isn't an opportunity to match to. Otherwise a new opportunity will be created unless you check the 'Don't create an opportunity upon conversion' checkbox.
Optional doesnt mean it will not be there

questions.question_text: When a Lead is converted, an Account, Contact and _______ record are created.
In List View Enhancements, users can export list results to CSV file

discussion.content:
You cannot export list view, you will need to create a report and export the report into excel
https://success.salesforce.com/answers?id=9063A000000st19QAA

o export an Account List view, there is no real export functionality. You can click on the Printable view icon on the top right corner after you run the list view (printer icon) and then copy paste into an Excel spreadsheet.


answer seems wrong ?

The easy way to export a list view is to click on the printer icon in the top-right corner of the list view: this produces a pop-up window with a printable view. You then select the rows/columns, copy and then paste

https://success.salesforce.com/answers?id=90630000000h2U0AAI

questions.question_text: Export to Excel is available for Printable Lists:
When you configure Search Settings for Your Organization, the new value must be between 5 and 50

discussion.content:
It is possible to configure, and the limit is from 5 to 50.
http://theblogreaders.com/configure-search-result-limit-salesforce-classic-lightning-experience/
Members can be individuals, roles, public groups, territories, connections, or partner users.
Why roles? If you assign a record in a queue to a "Role" then anyone with the role can grab it?
